numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Young people are generally more optimistic than elderly people.
2. Rapid development happened in recent years.
3. This rapid development could cause the optimism of young people.
4. People who are 15 years old to 24 years old were born around 2000.
5. People who are 15 years old to 24 years old experienced an extreme pace of development.
6. Fifteen years ago, most people used simple phones.
7. These simple phones had only a communication function.
8. Now many people use smartphones.
9. Some smartphones are iPhones.
10. Some smartphones are Huawei phones.
11. Some smartphones are Samsung phones.
12. Smartphones have many different functions.
13. Smartphones bring convenience to people's lives.
14. Smartphones can connect people all over the world.
15. Smartphones can help people share their lives.
16. Smartphones can help people play games.
17. Smartphones can help people watch videos.
18. People can use smartphones at any time.
19. People can use smartphones anywhere.
20. Many young people cannot imagine life before the popularity of the Internet and smartphones.
21. This situation may be a big reason for the optimism of young people.
22. A survey had 21000 people.
23. A survey with 21000 people is relatively small.
24. Some people are 25 years old to 40 years old.
25. The survey neglected people who are 25 years old to 40 years old.
26. People who are 25 years old to 40 years old should have a right to express their thoughts.
27. People in our country did not participate in this survey.
28. An intelligent society brings great convenience to me.
29. I do not want to give up this change.
30. I do not want to imagine how inconvenient life was 20 years ago.
31. I do not want to imagine how inconvenient life was 30 years ago.
32. The headline is: Optimistic About the Future?
